Nice! I’ve been a software engineer for 7+ years. Here’s my unsolicited advise. Most leads and seniors don’t know exactly how to deal with junior developers. So, understand that they are learning about themselves when dealing with you, too. Expect to have no idea what is going on in the code and anticipate that things will slowly click. You’ll never fully understand the entire codebase. What’s most important is you focus on being productive. Pay attention to how to push code and their deployment process. Try to make a class diagram of the codebase landmark areas. Write down the steps they perform to make changes. Learn their process. If you show interest in the workflow process, you’ll be given more work. And, the money in your future is definitely real. The first jobs always pay low. Just stick with it and keep interviewing skills fresh. It will happen quicker than you realize. Just bought my second house. Good luck
